caption:
This image portrays a fire burning through a field. The foreground of the photograph is dominated by bright flames licking at dry grass and a blackened area, suggesting that the fire has already consumed part of this terrain. Above the flames, smoke, a mix of gray and faint bluish hues, rises into the sky, blurring the horizon and mingling with the clouds above.

The background reveals a flat, expansive landscape that extends under a wide sky. This area appears to be rural with minimal vegetation. A few isolated trees dot the landscape in the distance, with one more prominently visible against the horizon. There is a noticeable contrast between the dark, scorched earth where the fire has passed, and patches of untouched, golden-brown grass ahead and around the blaze.

Overall, the image captures a moment of natural devastation, highlighting the destructive power of fire as it spreads uncontrollably over dry farmland, reshaping the quiet rural scenery into a scene of dynamic and dangerous activity. The absence of people or any firefighting efforts suggests the remoteness of the location or the initial stages of the fire outbreak.
title: This entire field of straw, west of el centro in the imperial valley, burned off in less than half an hour.  Smoke was visible for 20 miles.  Owner wished to clear field for quick planting of another crop
